manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: octopus, urine, longbow, laundry, shotgun, groundhog, washcloth, cotton, drawers.
Your opponent's team words are: pocketbook, kidney, chopsticks, badge, toe, hubcap, eggroll, knee.
Distractor words are: biceps, porch, quilt, camel, corn, bourbon, nectarine.
The kill words are: rainfall.

message.reasoning_content:
Alright, so I need to figure out which words from the given list are most closely associated with 'household'. The list provided is: rainfall, porch, urine, hubcap, corn, shotgun, nectarine, drawers, pocketbook, quilt, washcloth, chopsticks, eggroll, biceps, bourbon, camel, knee, groundhog.

First off, I know that a household consists of things you'd find in or related to a home. So, items used around the house or parts of the house itself could be good candidates. Let me go through each word and see if it relates somehow to being inside or part of a house.

Rainfall doesn't seem directly related since it's about weather outside. Porch is an area attached to a house, so that might count. Urine isn't really something I associate with households; more like personal or animal waste. Hubcap relates to cars, which are outside often but not inherently household items. Corn is a plant and could be part of gardening, maybe in a yard, not sure about the house. Shotgun is tricky—it's both a gun and a type of building structure in some contexts, like a shotgun house.

Nectarine is a fruit and doesn't seem related to households. Drawers are definitely part of furniture you'd find in a house, so that's a strong candidate. Pocketbook might relate to carrying money or small items, but not directly a household item. Quilt is used in homes for comfort, so that fits. Washcloth is clearly something used in bathrooms or kitchens within a house. Chopsticks are cooking utensils, commonly found in households. Eggroll is also food-related and can be made at home.

Biceps aren't related to households. Bourbon is an alcohol often consumed at home, but it's more about activities than objects. Camel doesn't have any relation that I can think of. Knee might relate to movement or anatomy, not directly a household item. Groundhog is an animal, so no connection there.

So, from this evaluation, the words that best fit as related to 'household' are porch, drawers, quilt, washcloth, chopsticks, and eggroll.
